message.entry: Connect Hardware
1) Connect the Micro USB Type B end of the cable to the USB port of the PlutoSDR.\n\n2) Connect the USB Type A end of the cable to a USB port of the host computer.
You need Micro USB Type B to USB Type A cable and a host computer with a USB port.
Cannot find an ADALM-PLUTO radio. Connect a radio to continue.
Found more than one ADALM-PLUTO radio. Connect only one radio for firmware update.
The radio with ID {0} is already owned by a block, block dialog, or System object. Stop the simulation, close the open dialog, or call the release method of the System object to continue.
Driver installation failed with message:\n{0}
Install USB Driver
You need to install the PlutoSDR USB driver to use your radio.
Click "Next" to start the USB driver installer app.
Installation of USB driver requires Administrator privileges. If you see a window asking you to give permission to the app to make changes to your PC, click "Yes" to continue.
Install udev Rules
You need to install the udev rule for PlutoSDR to use your radio.
Click "Next" to start the udev rule installation. You will be asked to enter your sudo password on the MATLAB command window.
Installation of udev rules requires Administrator privileges. If you do not have sudo permissions, contact your system administrator.
Install Library for Interfacing with IIO Devices (libiio)
You need to install the Library for Interfacing with IIO Devices (libiio) to use your radio.
Click "Next" to start the libiio installation.

Installation of libiio requires Xcode Command Line Developer Tools. If you do not have Xcode Command Line Developer Tools, a popup window will appear. Follow the instructions to install these tools. After installation of Xcode Command Line Developer Tools, click "Next" again to finish installing libiio.
libiio installation failed with message:\n\n{0}
No Compiler Found
You need a supported C compiler to use ADALM-PLUTO radio with MATLAB, but your host computer does not have one installed.
Visit Mac® App Store to install Xcode®, Apple®'s C compiler for macOS®.
After completing compiler installation, continue ADALM-PLUTO setup via Add-Ons > Manage Add-Ons. Find the ADALM-PLUTO support package and click the gear icon.
See Supported and Compatible Compilers.
Configure ADALM-PLUTO Radio

The AD9363 RF part in the Pluto SDR is specified to operate from 325 MHz to 3.8 GHz. This support package reconfigures the radio to operate over a tuning range of 70 MHz to 6 GHz with a 56 MHz channel bandwidth. Click “Configure” to enable this operating range.
Configure
Check USB connection
Update radio configuration
If USB connection fails, disconnect and reconnect your radio and try again.
If configuration fails, refer to "Common Problems and Fixes" section of the documentation. Type plutoradiodoc(''sdrpluto_troubleshoot'') to open this section.
Connecting to hardware...
Connected to hardware...
Failed to connect to hardware.

entry.note: As in changing the radio settings

message.entry: Configuring radio...
Checking USB connection...
Done configuring radio and host.
If the configuration succeeds, click Next to finish the setup process.
If the configuration fails, click Back and follow the instructions again.

Cannot connect to radio using serial port. Refer to "Hardware Setup on Linux — Configure ADALM-PLUTO Radio Failure" in "Common Problems and Fixes" section of the documentation. Type plutoradiodoc(''sdrpluto_troubleshoot'') to open this section.
Test ADALM-PLUTO Radio Connection
Radio Platform
Radio ID
Serial Number
Test Connection
Search and connect
Test transmitter
Test receiver
This test will transmit and receive signals using the radio. We recommend that you install antennas on both transmitter and receiver ports.
If ''Radio ID'' is ''Not found'', disconnect and reconnect your radio and click "Test Connection" button.
If the connection tests fail, check that you have antennas connected to your radio, click Back, and follow the instructions again.
Done testing PlutoSDR connection.
Cannot find an ADALM-PLUTO radio. Connect a radio and restart hardware setup.
Unexpected PlutoSDR Radio Firmware

ADALM-PLUTO radio with serial number ''{0}'' has firmware version "{1}". MathWorks recommends radio firmware version "{2}" with the Communications Toolbox Support Package for Analog Devices ADALM-PLUTO Radio. If you do not want to update your radio firmware to the recommended version, uncheck the following checkbox.
Update firmware to recommended version
ADALM-PLUTO support package is tested with radio firmware version "{0}". Using the support package with a different firmware version may result in unexpected behavior.
If you update the firmware with this application, later you can revert to your current firmware version ("{0}") following the instructions in Pluto Firmware Updates.
Update PlutoSDR Radio Firmware
This hardware setup app will guide you to update radio firmware to version "{0}". Click ''Update Firmware'' button to start firmware update.
Update Firmware
Find PlutoSDR mass storage device drive
Copy firmware files to PlutoSDR mass storage device
Wait for PlutoSDR mass storage device to be ejected
Update firmware
Test firmware update
See Pluto Firmware Updates for more information on updating the firmware.
If firmware update fails, you can manually try to update the firmware following the steps in Pluto Firmware Updates. Compatible firmware files are downloaded to here.
Eject PlutoSDR mass storage device using ''{0}''. Right click PlutoSDR drive and select ''Eject', which will cause firmware programming to start and LED1 to blink rapidly. {1}
Do NOT eject using ''Safely Remove Hardware and Eject Media'' icon on the Taskbar.
Timed out waiting for eject. Click 'Update firmware' to start again.
Select PlutoSDR mass storage device drive
Do not remove power (or USB) while the device is blinking rapidly. It takes approximately 4 minutes to properly program the device.
Cannot find PlutoSDR mass storage device: {0}
PlutoSDR radio is not mounted or not accessible as a mass storage device.
The hardware setup process for ADALM-PLUTO radio is complete.
Cannot connect to radio. Check radio connection.
Cannot get radio configuration. Check radio connection.

USB connection to radio with radio ID ''{0}'' failed. Check that radio is connected to your host computer. If so, release the radio System object and try again. If you still cannot connect, reinstall the USB driver using the Hardware Setup App. Start the ADALM-PLUTO setup via Add-Ons > Manage Add-Ons. Find the ADALM-PLUTO support package and click the gear icon. See Common Problems and Fixes.
